articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Fruit Farm
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Fruit Farm
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, provided field guidance to the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm rebuilt on an expansion basis and the newly built Taedonggang Combined Fruit Processing Factory.
					 The first leg of his guidance was the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm. 
					
					 The builders worked such astonishing miracles as completing the project for expanding the capacity in a short span of time, which is tantamount to a grand nature-harnessing project and successfully built an apple tree nursery covering 50 hectares, in particular, thereby establishing a fruit tree sapling production system based on tissue culture. This made it possible to lay a firm foundation to produce and ensure fruit tree saplings by itself.
					
					 After being briefed on the newly built Taedonggang Pig Farm, the Taedonggang Turtle Farm and the Taedonggang Net Factory newly built in the area of the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm before a huge map showing its panoramic view, he went round various places of the farm including the Taedonggang Apple Tree Nursery to acquaint himself in detail with the construction and fruit cultivation. 
					
					 The construction of such large-scale fruit farm as the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm is a great project which can be undertaken only under the socialist system of the DPRK which regards collectivism as its life and soul, he said, adding: Great, indeed, is the mental power of the army and the people of the DPRK singly-mindedly united around their party and leader.
					
					 Noting that the farm is a great structure suited to the appearance of the new century, he said: The appearance of the country is changing day by day thanks to the dynamic drive for a great surge across the country and this remarkable change confidently heralds a bright future of a powerful nation to appear in the near future.
					
					 The combined farm is a model farm of weighty significance not only in supplying fruits to the people but also in developing the nation's fruit farming on a modern basis, he said, putting forward the important tasks facing the factory and the farm.
					
					 In order to increase the fertility of soil in the orchards of the farm it is necessary to make an effective use of circular production system of fruit growing and stock breeding, stock breeding and fruit growing, he noted, underlining the need to revitalize the management of the Taedonggang Pig Farm and apply more organic compound fertilizers to orchards.
					
					 Relevant units should pay deep attention to the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm as it is an important farm conducive to improving the diet of the people, he said, calling on them to ensure the production and supply of sufficient quantities of equipment and raw materials including machines, agricultural chemicals and fertilizers needed in the farm.
					
					 The next leg of his guidance was the Taedonggang Combined Processing Factory.
					
					  The Factory covering 49 000 square meters is a modern and combined producer of processed fruits. It is capable of annually producing tens of thousands of tons of processed fruits including varieties of juice, cider, jam, liquor, vinegar, perfume, shampoo and rinse by enriching fruits such as apple, pear, peach and strawberry.
					
					 It is a great success that the soldier-builders, workers of the factory and their helpers have successfully built in a brief span of time the modern and combined fruit processing factory desired by people, he said, expressing great satisfaction over the fact that they have built another  model factory representing the era of Songun.
					
					 He noted that the factory has been built at the best level of quality and is equipped with the latest technical facilities. He said with confidence that the experience eloquently proves that when officials thoroughly apply the Party's idea of attaching importance to science and technology with a high sense of the Party spirit, the revolutionary spirit and the serve-the-people spirit and steadily create something new, boldly getting rid of the ready-made conception, they can bring all the fields including the foodstuff industry to the highest level in a short span of time and effect a radical turn in improving the standard of people's living.
					
					 The important task facing the factory is to boost the production of varieties of processed fruits helpful to improving the standard of people's living by use of the newly laid production foundation and ensure their quality and hygienic security, he noted.
					
					 He repeatedly praised all the builders and their helpers who carried out the project for expanding the capacity of the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm and the construction of the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Processing Factory for their great contributions to the sacred drive for the prosperity of the country and extended thanks to them. 
					
					 He was accompanied by senior officials of the party and armed forces  Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yong Il, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Thae Jong Su, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, Ju Kyu Chang, U Tong Chuk and Kim Chang Sop, Members of the Central Military Commission of the WPK Kim Kyong Ok, Kim Won Hong, Kim Yong Chol and Yun Jong Rin and Department Director of the NDC Hyon Chol Hae.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by National Symphony Orchestra
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by National Symphony Orchestra
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, enjoyed a performance given by the National Symphony Orchestra.
					 Its repertoire included the second movement "His Life" and the fifth movement "Appearing in the East and in the West, It's the Anti-Japanese Guerilla Style" of symphony suite "O Korea, I Will Add Glory to Thee", string ensemble "Chollima Runs", orchestra "Rich Harvest Comes to the Chongsan Plain" and serial symphony "Song to the Party".
					
					 Greatly satisfied with the fact that the creators and artistes of the National Symphony Orchestra gave a splendid performance with high artistry and enthusiasm, Kim Jong Il highly praised them for their successful performance and extended thanks to them.
					
					 The conductors and players of the National Symphony Orchestra successfully represented all the music pieces suited to the national emotion and aesthetic taste of the times, he noted, praising them for their sincere and enthusiastic creative style and attitude to steadily raise their ability and artistry.
					
					 The orchestra of Korean style, a full embodiment of the Juche character, the national identity and musical character in the field of musical art, is fully meeting the cultural and emotional requirements of the Korean people and positively contributing to promoting friendship and exchange among countries as it reflects the desire of the people for independence and their noble spiritual world with rich and beautiful musical representation, he said, putting forward the important tasks which would serve as guidelines for further developing orchestra.
					
					 Among the audience were senior officials of the party and armed forces Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yong Il, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Thae Jong Su, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, Ju Kyu Chang, U Tong Chuk, Kim Chang Sop and Ri Myong Su, Members of the Central Military Commission of the WPK Kim Kyong Ok, Kim Won Hong, Kim Yong Chol and Yun Jong Rin, Department Director of the NDC Hyon Chol Hae and officials in the fields of literature and arts and media.

articles.title: Congratulations to Pakistani FM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Pakistani FM
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Hina Rabbani Khar upon her appointment as foreign minister of Pakistan.
					 The message wished her success in her work, expressing belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between two countries would continue to develop on good terms.

articles.title: Vietnam to Further Develop Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Vietnam to Further Develop Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The Vietnamese party, government and people remain steadfast in the will to boost the relations with the DPRK, said Deng The Huynh, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., Communist Party of Vietnam.
					 He, chairman of the Commission for Information and Education of the Party, Tuesday had a friendly talk with the visiting delegation of DPRK's Rodong Sinmun headed by Associate Editor Kim Won Sok.
					
					 Deng congratulated the Korean people on their successes made in building a socialist thriving nation under the guidance of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 We are rejoiced over the fact that the traditional ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries provided by President Ho Chi Minh and President Kim Il Sung have developed on good terms, he said.
					
					 He expressed the will to further develop these relations through exchange and cooperation.

articles.title: Senior Officials Enjoy New Drama
articles.content:
Senior Officials Enjoy New Drama
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Senior state officials and officials of the Cabinet, ministries and national institutions of the DPRK enjoyed drama "We Will Recollect Today", winner of Kim Il Sung Prize, on Wednesday.
					 The drama shows the indomitable mental power and ardent patriotism displayed by the people of a mountainous county in the drive to implement the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea on building medium- and small-scale hydraulic power stations during the Arduous March in the 1990s. It gives a profound philosophical clarification of the memory of faith and will, not memory of sorrow.
					
					 The drama, one of monumental masterpieces representing the literature and arts in the era of Songun, is going on before full houses, evoking a lively response from among people.

articles.title: Reception Given by Russian Ambassador to DPRK
articles.content:
Reception Given by Russian Ambassador to DPRK
Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Valery E. Sukhinin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, gave a reception at the embassy Thursday on the 50th anniversary of the conclusion of the DPRK-Soviet Union treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance.
					 Present there on invitation were Vice Minister of Foreign Affairs Kung Sok Ung and officials concerned.
					
					 Staff members of the embassy were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Nomination of Candidates for Deputies to People's Assemblies Wound up
articles.content:
Nomination of Candidates for Deputies to People's Assemblies Wound up
Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The nomination of candidates for deputies to people's assemblies of provinces (municipalities), cities (districts) and counties of the DPRK has been completed as of Wednesday. 
					 The voters' meetings held across the country nominated as candidates for deputies to local people's assemblies those officials, workers, farmers and intellectuals who can creditably discharge their duties as representatives of the people and servants of the people in the drive to build a socialist thriving country under the Songun revolutionary leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea, remaining intensely loyal to General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The election committees at all levels have put up names and photos of candidates for the deputies at constituencies and sub-constituencies and are pushing forward the preparations for the successful election at the final stage.

articles.title: Local Election Draws Near in DPRK
articles.content:
Local Election Draws Near in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The DPRK will have an election of deputies to local people's assemblies on July 24. 
					 All, above 17, with Korean citizenship have rights to be nominated as candidate for deputies irrespective of sex, nationality, religious belief, residence period, property and standards of learning.
					
					 Election committees throughout the country have made full preparations for voting.
					
					 Constituencies and sub-constituencies were already formed in the provinces (municipalities), cities (districts) and counties and meetings took place to nominate candidates. The lists of candidates and voters are displayed.
					
					 Members of the election committees frequently visit constituencies to introduce the significance, rules and procedures of the election, voting method and candidates' careers.
					
					 Posters calling for a large turnout are put up in all places of the country and mass media, including radio and TV, highlight election preparations.
					
					 Loudspeaker cars and itinerant art squads liven up the atmosphere of election in rush hours.

articles.title: Staff Members of Egyptian Embassy Here Visit Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace
articles.content:
Staff Members of Egyptian Embassy Here Visit Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Staff members of the Egyptian embassy here visited the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace on Thursday on the 59th anniversary of July 23 revolution in Egypt.
					 Being briefed on the fact that the palace has been built as a splendid centre for extracurricular education of children under the great care of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, they went round various rooms for hobby groups of the palace. 
					
					 Then they enjoyed a performance given by members of the art groups of the palace.

articles.title: DPRK Bags Gold Medal at Military World Games
articles.content:
DPRK Bags Gold Medal at Military World Games
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The DPRK won the women's 25m sports pistol title at the 5th Military World Games in Brazil.
					 Women shooters of the Korean People's Army scored 848 points, the highest marks in the team event, on Tuesday.

articles.title: Visitors to DPRK Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Visitors to DPRK Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace Thursday to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung.
					 Among them were the delegation of the Press and Information Department of the Vietnamese Foreign Ministry led by Director General Nguyen Phuong Nga, Glyn Ford, member of the National Policy Forum of the British Labor Party, and his companion and the delegation of the Fukuoka Prefectural Japan-DPRK Friendship Association led by Chairman Mamoru Kitahara.
					
					 The visitors made deep bows to the President with profound reverence for him.

articles.title: Korean People Vow to Defend Nation's Sovereignty
articles.content:
Korean People Vow to Defend Nation's Sovereignty
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Many people, including schoolchildren, have visited houses of class education across the country in the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 In Pyongyang thousands of people visit the National House of Class Education every day.
					
					 The house exhibits materials exposing crimes committed by the U.S. imperialists against the Korean people from a hundred and scores of years ago.
					
					 Conspicuous in the exhibits is the figure of those killed by the U.S. invaders, south Korean troops and other class enemies in the northern part of Korea during the temporary strategic retreat of the Korean People's Army in the Fatherland Liberation War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953).
					
					 The Sinchon Museum houses materials showing brutal massacres of civilians by enemies in a premeditated and systematic way.
					
					 The curator of the Susan-ri House of Class Education, Choe Jong Suk, said that nearly 100,000 people have visited the house from the beginning of the year. The house provides them with a good knowledge of heinous crimes perpetrated by the U.S. imperialists in Korea after unleashing a war, she added.
					
					 After visiting houses of class education, they met and voiced their determination to smash the reckless moves of the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean regime to start another war and defend the dignity and the sovereignty of the nation.

articles.title: British Guests Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
British Guests Visit Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Glyn Ford, member of the National Policy Forum of the British Labor Party, and his companion Thursday visited Mangyongdae, birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They looked round relics at the old home of the President there, being briefed on the history of his revolutionary activities and Mangyongdae family members.
					
					 They posed for a souvenir picture before touring revolutionary relics on Mangyong Hill.
					
					 They also visited the Tower of the Juche Idea, the E-Library of Kim Il Sung University and other places.

articles.title: Early Peaches Supplied to Children
articles.content:
Early Peaches Supplied to Children
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Early peaches produced in Kwail County, South Hwanghae Province, were supplied to the children in the capital city of Pyongyang.
					 The convoy carrying them arrived in Pyongyang Thursday.
					
					 The fruits were sent to Kim Jong Suk Nursery and Kang Pan Sok Nursery and other nurseries and kindergartens.

articles.title: Achievements in Pisciculture of DPRK
articles.content:
Achievements in Pisciculture of DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- In the DPRK the fry production remarkably increased this year as compared with the same period of last year and the project for updating fish breeding bases has made brisk headway.
					 The Pyongyang Catfish Farm raised the amount of fry catfish of good breed over two times that of last year to supply to different units.
					
					 Songhwa, Myongchon, Taegwan and other catfish farms have produced tens of millions of fry catfish through introduction of scientific methods this year.
					
					 The Pyongyang City Fish Farming Management Bureau increased the fry production twice as compared with last year. The Samsok Breed-fish Station put egg taking and hatching on a scientific and technological basis to suit the ecological characteristics of fish species, thus carrying out its yearly plan for fry production 200 percent.
					
					 Nampho City and Unsan, Sohung, Kumya, Jongphyong and other counties provided conditions favorable for spawning in rivers and streams while enhancing the role of fish farms.
					
					 A drive to modernize fish breeding bases is progressing apace.
					
					 The Tudan Breed-fish Station in Pyongyang, now under way of renovation, is speeding up the construction of general control room and other buildings at the final stage.
					
					 Unsan, Ryongchon and many other breed-fish stations, too, have pushed ahead with work to introduce the general control system in production processes, build feed processing bases and rebuild fishponds.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Performed in History of National United Front
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Performed in History of National United Front
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- 65 years have passed since the formation of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea.
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il, who perfectly embodied President Kim Il Sung's Juche-oriented idea on national united front, published a lot of works on the great national unity and national reunification in every period and at every stage of the developing revolution through his ceaseless thinking and inquiry, thus performing undying feats in the cause of great national unity and national reunification.
					
					 In the early 1970s Kim Jong Il authored the work "Let Us Struggle Resolutely to Implement the Three Principles of National Reunification", which indicates ways for the Korean people to conduct a vigorous reunification movement with clear-cut principle and standard.
					
					 His steadfast will to translate into brilliant reality the President's desire for national reunification is reflected in such works as "Officials Should Devote Themselves to National Reunification" and "Let Us Accelerate Socialist Construction and Hasten National Reunification, Holding the Great Leader in High Esteem".
					
					 In "Answers to Questions Raised by the General Director of Granma, the Organ of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba" and other works, he proved in detail that founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo is the just and realistic reunification proposal.
					
					 In the work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification" he comprehensively systematized the immortal feats of the President performed in the cause of national reunification.
					
					 In 1998 he authored the work "Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully through the Great Unity of the Entire Nation" to mark the 50th anniversary of the April north-south joint conference. Clarified in it is the five-point policy of great national unity.
					
					 After the adoption of the June 15 joint declaration he published such works as "National Reunification Should Be Achieved Independently by United Efforts of Our Nation" and "On Having a Correct Understanding of Nationalism". In the works he called upon all Koreans to work hard to open a new phase of independent reunification in the idea of "By our nation itself" while meeting every challenge of the separatist forces at home and abroad.

articles.title: Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (18)
articles.content:
Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (18)
Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The Songam Cavern known to the country as a scenic spot of the people is associated with the fatherly loving care shown by General Secretary Kim Jong Il for ordinary working people.
					Among them is Kim Myong Ok, a room chief of the Songam Cavern Management Station.
					
					It was in April of 2002 that she had the honor of briefing the leader on it when he was visiting the cavern. 
					
					 He praised her for good briefing and spared time to listen to her singing. He was so kind as to give her a laser pointer, telling her to do her bit for making the scenic spot for people more famous. He helped the girl's beautiful dream of love come true. She worked heart and soul to make the story about the fatherly love for the people go down in history. She trained dozens of lecturers and distinguished herself in sprucing up the room devoted to the history of the cavern on the best level.
					
					 She is still keeping herself busy effectively organizing the tour and education so that an increasing number of visitors may deeply grasp his fatherly love associated with the cavern.

articles.title: Provocative Remarks of Speaker of S. Korean National Assembly Blasted
articles.content:
Provocative Remarks of Speaker of S. Korean National Assembly Blasted
Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Pak Hui Thae, speaker of the south Korean National Assembly, slandered the DPRK in his so-called speech made at "a meeting observing the constitution day" on July 17. He talked about "differences between constitutional ideas" and the like, while letting loose a whole string of jargons about "human dignity and value."
					Rodong Sinmun Thursday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					What he uttered is nothing but sheer sophism intended to cover up the miserable reality of south Korea, scenes of rowdyism of fascism and dictatorship and a hell on earth, and divert elsewhere public resentment. It is provocative remarks bringing to light his inveterate antagonism toward the DPRK. 
					
					"Human dignity and value" and "freedom and equality" touted by the fascist dictators are nothing but an intolerable mockery and insult to the south Korean people struggling for democracy and human rights. 
					
					Pak's reckless remarks only betray his traitorous scenario to realize the wild ambition for "unifying systems" by embellishing the corrupt political system in south Korea as much as possible. 
					
					No matter how noisily the ferocious fascist dictators and kingpins of human rights abuses may talk about "dignity" and "equality" to sling mud at the DPRK, no one would lend an ear to it. 
					
					Lee group had better care about the abyss of ruin in which it is now finding itself, cursed and denounced by the public, before pulling up others, urges the commentary.

articles.title: Anti-"Government" Sit-in Strike Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-"Government" Sit-in Strike Staged in S. Korea 
Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Members of the preparatory committee of the south Korean Meeting of People for Building New Society on July 18 joined those who have been on a hunger sit-in strike in Seoul since July 13 in protest against the authorities' unreasonable lay-off and suppression of trade unions.
					 They held a press conference in this regard.
					
					 Speakers at the press conference said workers, peasants and the poor are complaining they could not live any longer but the "government" and plutocrats are driving them into an abyss of death, indifferent to them, they deplored.
					
					 They condemned the authorities for intensifying the suppression of the people, prompted by their sinister intention to safely spend the remaining period of their office at any cost.
					
					Actions alone would help them regain their vital rights and check the authorities' moves to stamp out trade unions, they noted.
					
					 They declared they would join in the hunger sit-in to punish the Lee Myung Bak regime, the regime serving big businessmen.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Human Right Committee's Repressive Actions Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Human Right Committee's Repressive Actions Slammed
Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea on July 18 issued a commentary condemning the puppet Human Rights Committee for its repressive actions.
					 The committee is set to punish 11 members who staged a demonstration in protest against the unreasonable lay-off, the commentary said.
					
					The above-said protest was made because Lee Myung Bak appointed anti-human rights element Hyon Pyong Chol as its chairman, it noted.
					
					 It was Hyon who paralyzed the function of the human rights institution and took actions against democracy, it said, adding that this was the reason why members of the committee resigned en masse last year.
					
					 It is quite hard for the committee to properly perform its job as long as such guy busy doing everything for the sake of the Lee regime only, indifferent to the human rights, is allowed to stay in the committee, it said, urging him to cancel the repressive step at once and step down.

articles.title: S. Korea: Teachers Protest "Government's" Repression
articles.content:
S. Korea: Teachers Protest "Government's" Repression
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The Teachers Union of south Korea in a commentary on July 18 denounced the "government" authorities' crackdown.
					 The Ministry of Science and Technology on July 11 urged again a heavy disciplinary step against teachers of the Union who participated in the campaign to publish declaration on the situation in 2009, the commentary noted.
					
					 This is a reckless suppression and provocation of the present "government" to the teachers and people desirous of progressive education, it said, adding:
					
					 The UN Human Rights Council expressed concern about the fact that members of the Union have been investigated, dismissed and put under surveillance for the mere reason that they published the peaceful declaration. And it adopted a report recommending the "government" to ensure their freedom of expression and rights.
					
					 Such behavior of the "government" as persisting in suppression of union members can never be pardoned, the commentary said.

articles.title: Songun Policy Supported by Finnish Party
articles.content:
Songun Policy Supported by Finnish Party
Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Tyokansan Sanomat, organ of the Communist Workers' Party of Finland for the Peace and Socialism, carried an article to mark the 51st anniversary of Songun revolutionary leadership started by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The article said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il is boundlessly praised by the world community for having enforced the original Songun policy.
					
					 The Songun policy is the most effective independent politics based on the Juche idea. 
					
					 Thanks to the Songun policy of Kim Jong Il, the national defense capacity of the DPRK has been boosted in every way and a solid guarantee has been provided for achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 The Korean people will emerge victorious in the future, too as they are single-mindedly united and uphold the Songun policy.
					
					 We fully support the Songun policy of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 We extend firm support and solidarity to the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people in their struggle to build a socialist thriving nation under the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Foreign Newspapers 
Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried articles on the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Russian paper Raboche-Krestiyanskaya Pravda No. 7 in its article said the President is the great man who liberated the Korean people from the colonial rule of Japanese imperialism.
					
					 Noting that the behests of the President are becoming brilliant realities in the DPRK, the paper added: The Korean people are living, confident of the future, enjoying the benefits of free medical care and free education.
					
					 The Myanmar paper The City News said in an article on July 7 the President defeated two imperialisms and built a socialist power of Korean style on the debris and brought the people only pleasure and happiness.
					
					 It introduced the noble trait of the President who always found himself among people and shared weal and woe with them.
					
					 The Romanian paper Romania Muncitoare No. 186 carried an article under the title of "President Kim Il Sung is always alive" illustrated with a photo of the President among schoolchildren.
					
					 The President is always alive in the hearts of the Korean people, the article noted, adding that this would be unthinkable without his great feats performed for the people in his lifetime and noble popular traits.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Marked by Guinean Radios
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Marked by Guinean Radios
Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Guinean radios on July 14 aired commemorative programs on the 39th anniversary of "Let Us Struggle Resolutely to Implement the Three Principles of National Reunification", the work of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The domestic radio aired the following program under the title "Invariable reunification program of Korean nation:" 
					
					The work is an important work as it indicates the clearest way for fully applying the three principles of national reunification, independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity, advanced by President Kim Il Sung in the overall reunification movement of the Korean nation.
					
					 The three principles of national reunification have displayed their great might for the past decades as an invariable programme for reunification of the Korean nation thanks to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 All the Koreans will achieve the historic cause of national reunification without fail, true to the noble intention of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The international radio and the radio served in seven national languages aired the same program.

articles.title: Chinese Official Calls for Strengthening Management of Politics
articles.content:
Chinese Official Calls for Strengthening Management of Politics 
 Beijing, July 20 (KCNA) -- Zhou Yonggang, secretary of the Central Commission of Politics of China, underscored the need to strengthen the scientific management of administration and laws.   
					 He said this at a meeting of the Central Commission of Politics on July 15.
					
					 He said the reform of the judicial system and working system should be intensified to enhance the standard of supervising the law enforcement and steadily increase the authority of judicature and public confidence in it.

articles.title: China Welcomes Peace Accord in Sudan
articles.content:
China Welcomes Peace Accord in Sudan
 Beijing, July 20 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson for the Chinese Foreign Ministry in a news briefing on Tuesday welcomed a peace accord the Sudanese government signed with the Darfur rebel forces.
					 Both sides inked the agreement in Doha, Qatar, on July 14. 
					
					 The spokesperson said the agreement is another positive thing in the political process of Darfur and a manifestation of the Sudanese government's sincere effort to solve the Darfur issue in a political way through talks.
					
					 China hopes that the agreement will be implemented in a proper way, the spokesperson added.

articles.title: Lhasa-Gonggar Airport Expressway Opens to Traffic in Tibet, China
articles.content:
Lhasa-Gonggar Airport Expressway Opens to Traffic in Tibet, China
Beijing, July 20 (KCNA) -- The Tibet's first expressway, a 37.8-km road linking urban Lhasa, capital of south west China's Tibet Autonomous Region, with Lhasa's Gonggar airport, opened to traffic on July 17.
					 The project started in April 2009.

articles.title: US-Japan Military Alliance Aimed at China: Russian Radio
articles.content:
US-Japan Military Alliance Aimed at China: Russian Radio
 Moscow, July 20 (KCNA) -- A Russian radio reported an article disclosing the purpose of the U.S.-Japan military alliance on Monday.
					 Some time ago, the U.S. and Japanese defense chiefs agreed to strengthen military ties to cope with challenges in the Asia-Pacific region, the article said. By the challenges, they mean the increasing military strength of China, and they are directing the spearhead of the military alliance against China.
					
					 The U.S., afraid of China becoming a "marine power" and "air power", is using Japan as a main means for pressuring China, the article said, adding:
					
					 The U.S. and Japan threaten to take joint actions if China fails to behave itself well. For this purpose, they may launch joint military exercises getting on China's nerves.

articles.title: Russia Intensifies Anti-Terrorism Battle
articles.content:
Russia Intensifies Anti-Terrorism Battle
 Moscow, July 20 (KCNA) -- Russia has concentrated effort on battling terrorism.
					 The director of the Russian Federal Security Service revealed on Monday that about 400 cases of terrorism occurred in the country in the first half of last year but the figure was reduced to 169 in the same period of this year.

articles.title: Russia to Make Weather Balloons
articles.content:
Russia to Make Weather Balloons
 Moscow, July 20 (KCNA) -- The general director of the Russian Federal Space General Bureau elaborated on the main task of the general bureau at a recent TV interview.
					 The main task is to take back its position in markets of developing countries and the most important thing for the bureau is to regain its position in the world satellite market, he said.
					
					 Russia will make weather balloons for forecasting weather, climate change and contingencies within three years, he said. This year Russia will restore its GPS (global position system).

articles.title: Astronomical Observation Satellite Launched in Russia
articles.content:
Astronomical Observation Satellite Launched in Russia
Moscow, July 20 (KCNA) -- Russia launched astronomical observation satellite Spectr-P on July 18.
					 The satellite launched by carrier rocket Zenit-3SLBF at the Baikonur Space Launching Center was successfully put into orbit. 
					
					 This was clarified by the Federal Space General Bureau of Russia.

articles.title: Iran's High Cleric Calls upon All People to Get United
articles.content:
Iran's High Cleric Calls upon All People to Get United
Tehran, July 20 (KCNA) -- Iran's high cleric Mohammad Emami Kashani called upon all the people to get united. He said this in a speech at Tehran University on July 15.
					 The enemies are resorting to every move to deter Iran from developing, he noted, underlining the need for the people to shatter the plots of the enemies with utmost vigilance.
					
					 Unity is the only way for foiling the enemies' moves against Iran and meeting all their challenges and achieving the prosperity of the country, he added.

articles.title: Iran Condemns West's Conspiratorial Moves
articles.content:
Iran Condemns West's Conspiratorial Moves
Tehran, July 20 (KCNA) -- The secretary-general of Iran's High Council of Human Rights on July 16 condemned the West for its conspiratorial moves to mislead the human rights situation of his country.
					 The West is insisting on dispatching a special rapporteur to Iran while talking about its human rights issue. This was prompted by a political purpose as it is an unreasonable and unilateral idea, the secretary general said.
					
					 The U.S., Western countries and Israel are the worst violators of the human rights in the world, he said. The Iranian government will never accept the special rapporteur.

articles.title: Iran to Continue Long-Distance Navigation
articles.content:
Iran to Continue Long-Distance Navigation
 Tehran, July 20 (KCNA) -- Iran plans to continue long-distance navigation of naval vessels in international waters.
					 The Iranian navy commander announced on July 18 that the country will continue to dispatch vessels to international waters, including the Atlantic and the southern part of the Indian Ocean.

articles.title: Flood Kills 3 in Iran
articles.content:
Flood Kills 3 in Iran
Tehran, July 20 (KCNA) -- Flood claimed the lives of three people in northwestern Iran.
					 The flood caused by heavy rains in the past days damaged 50 villages.
					
					 A relief work is being done in the flood-stricken areas.

articles.title: US Soldier Killed in Iraq
articles.content:
U.S. Soldier Killed in Iraq
Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- More U.S. soldiers in Iraq met deaths due to the military operations of the Iraqi resistance forces.
					 An American soldier was killed during operations in southern Iraq on Friday.
					
					 Friday's casualty takes the overall U.S. death toll in Iraq since the March 2003 invasion to more than 4,470.

articles.title: Cooperation among Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Different Countries
Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Uruguay and China agreed on July 14 to expand cooperation and exchanges in such fields as politics, trade, culture, education and technology.
					 Brazil and Nicaragua signed new pacts on the same day to intensify energy cooperation.

articles.title: Nigeria Reiterates Commitment to Security
articles.content:
Nigeria Reiterates Commitment to Security
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Nigeria's Minister of Defense Bello Mohammed has said the country's commitment to international and regional organizations is to enhance global peace and security. He said this in a speech at the regional forum recently held in Abuja.
					 The minister expressed Nigeria's commitment to improving cooperation and partnership with the AU Peace and Security Division to enhance its peace support operations on the continent.

articles.title: Foodstuff Prices Up in Belarus
articles.content:
Foodstuff Prices Up in Belarus
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Foodstuff prices in Belarus were 26.1 percent higher in the first half of the year than in the same period of last year, said a media report. 
					 In June the prices were hiked 48.6 percent, a record high, compared with the same month of last year.

articles.title: Earthquakes Hit Chile, US
articles.content:
Earthquakes Hit Chile, US
Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- A 6-magnitude earthquake occurred in waters off Valparaiso, Chile on July 15.
					 The epicenter was south waters.
					
					 A 6.1-magnitude earthquake jolted Alaska State, the U.S. on July 16.
					
					 The epicenter was 70 km southwest of Sand Point.

articles.title: Cuadros de Estado presencian drama "Recordaremos el dia de hoy"
articles.content:
Cuadros de Estado presencian drama "Recordaremos el dia de hoy"
　Pyongyang, 21 de julio (ATCC) -- Los cuadros directivos del Estado y funcionarios del Consejo de Ministros, ministerios y organos centrales presenciaron el dia 20 el drama "Recordaremos el dia de hoy", laureado con el Premio Kim Il Sung.
					　El drama muestra la indoblegable fuerza espiritual y el ardiente amor por la tierra natal de los habitantes de un distrito montanoso que se esforzaron por materializar la orientacion del partido de construir las centrales hidroelectricas de mediano y pequeno tamanos durante el periodo de la marcha penosa en la decada de 1990.
					
					　Ademas, ofrece una profunda elucidacion filosofica sobre la memoria de fe y voluntad, no la de la tristeza.
					
					　Esta obra monumental, que representa la literatura y arte de la epoca del Songun, se ofrece con exito produciendo grandes repercusiones de los espectadores.

articles.title: Terminada presentacion de candidatos a diputados
articles.content:
Terminada presentacion de candidatos a diputados 
　Pyongyang, 21 de julio (ATCC) -- Terminaron por completo hasta el dia 20 las labores de recomendar a los candidatos a los diputados a las Asambleas Populares de las provincias (las ciudades directamente subordinadas al centro), las ciudades (los municipios) y los distritos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					　En las reuniones de los votantes para recomendarlos efectuadas en todas las localidades de Corea fueron presentados los funcionarios, obreros, campesinos e intelectuales quienes son fieles infinitamente al Dirigente Kim Jong Il y pueden cumplir sus obligaciones y deberes como representantes del pueblo y servidores a este en las labores para construir el Estado prospero socialista siguiendo a la direccion del partido sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun. 
					
					　Los comites electorales a todos niveles dieron a publicidad en los distritos y subdistritos electorales a los candidatos a los diputados elegidos e impulsan en la etapa final los preparativos para la efectuacion exitosos de las elecciones.

articles.title: Corea esta en visperas de elecciones a diputados
articles.content:
Corea esta en visperas de elecciones a diputados 
　Pyongyang, 21 de julio (ATCC) -- Ahora la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea esta en pleno ambiente electoral en visperas del dia de elecciones (24 de julio) a los diputados a los organos del poder local.
					　En la RPDC todas las personas con mas de 17 anos de edad, entre ellos, obreros, campesinos e intelectuales con derechos civiles, pueden ser electos como candidatos a los diputados independientemente del sexo, nacionalidad, creencia religiosa, periodo de permanencia, bienes y la diferencia del nivel de conocimientos.
					
					　Los comites electorales de distintas localidades dinamizan los preparativos y la propaganda para asegurar bien las elecciones.
					
					　Fueron organizados los comites y subdistritos electorales en las provincias (las ciudades directamente subordinadas al centro), las ciudades (los municipios) y los distritos y tuvieron lugar las reuniones por presentar a los candidatos a los diputados y quedaron colgadas las listas de los candidatos y  votantes junto con las tablas de aviso.
					
					　Los integrantes de los comites electorales acuden a los distritos electorales encargados, donde dan a conocer la importancia y significado de las elecciones, los reglamentos detallados en la ejecucion de la ley, sedes de elecciones, formalidades de votos, metodos de votar y aviso de los candidatos a los diputados.
					
					　Saltan a la vista en todos los rincones de Pyongyang y otras provincias (las ciudades directamente subordinadas al centro), ciudades, municipios y distritos las pancartas exhortando a participar unanimemente en las elecciones.
					
					　A su vez, los periodicos divulgan continuamente los articulos relativos a las elecciones.
					
					　Las radios y cadenas TV remiten distintos datos en las horas de alta popularidad.
					
					　En las horas de llegada y salida del trabajo, se activan las actividades artisticas y de agitacion de coches de altavoces y miembros de los grupos de propaganda artistica movil.

articles.title: Tiradoras coreanas ganan medalla de oro
articles.content:
Tiradoras coreanas ganan medalla de oro
　Pyongyang, 21 de julio (ATCC) -- Las tiradoras coreanas del Ejercito Popular de Corea ocuparon el dia 19 el primer lugar con 848 puntos en la competencia de tiro de pistola sports a 25 m de distancia del colectivo femenino de los V Juegos Militares Mundiales que se efectuan en Brasil.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia a Pak Hui Thae
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia a Pak Hui Thae
　Pyongyang, 21 de julio (ATCC) -- El dia 17, el presidente de la Asamblea Nacional del Sur de Corea Pak Hi Thae, en su "discurso de felicitacion por el Dia de Constitucion", hablo de la "dignidad y el valor del ser humano" y calumnio siniestramente la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea refiriendose a "diferencias de los ideales constitucionales". 
					　Tal conducta es expresion de la hostilidad a la RPDC encubriendo la tragica realidad del Sur de Corea, infierno humano colmado de fascismo y dictadura.
					
					　Senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido este jueves y continua:
					
					　Los dictadores fascistas hablaron tanto de la "dignidad y el valor del ser humano" y de la "libertad e igualdad", lo cual es insulto y burla a los habitantes surcoreanos que luchan por la democracia y los derechos humanos.
					
					　Nadie prestara atencion a la "dignidad" e "igualdad" de que hablan los dictadores fascistas y caudillos de la violacion de DDHH.
					
					　Antes de censurar a alguien, la banda de Lee Myung Bak debe pensar primero en su moribundo destino repudiado y condenado por la opinion publica.
